availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel M. Ragon (Trigg County, Kentucky, wagon maker and merchant.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, wagon maker and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Martha S. Nance Ragon in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 26, 1844. Father of John H. Ragon, Elenore Ragon, and Martha A. Ragon. Married to Sarah E. Harvey Ragon in Logan County, Kentucky on August 8, 1855. Father of Mary M. Ragon. Married to Mary Hawkins Ragon in Trigg County, Kentucky, on March 25, 1863. Wagon maker in Trigg County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Wagon maker in Trigg County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Merchant in Trigg County in 1863.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335, p. 102.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994046, Logan County Marriages, p. 134.
